step.cmd: Click on the New tier button in the top right corner of the view.
step.stepresult: This action will generate a dialog prompting you specify details about the new tier.

step.cmd: Enter a name for the new tier. If the new tier should be a group aligned tier, select the Grouped (word-aligned) check box. Select an appropriate font for the new tier, or click the Use default font button to choose the default editor font. Click Ok.
step.stepresult: The new tier will show up at the bottom of each record.

step.cmd: To edit the font for a user-defined tier, select it from the list of tiers in the Tier Management view and click the Edit tier... button at the top right corner, or right-click on a tier and choose Edit tier <tier name>. Select the new font options and click Ok.
step.stepresult: That tier will reflect your new font choice in the Record Data view. To reset the tier font to the default, right-click (CTRL+click) on the tier and choose Reset font from the context menu.
